reference: Pinedo, Michael. 'Scheduling: Theory, Algorithms, and Systems.' Springer, 5th edition (2016).
math_formula:
### Mathematical Model
Consider a flow shop with n jobs and m machines, where:
- **Sets**:
  - J: Set of jobs {1, ..., n}
  - S: Set of schedule positions {1, ..., n}
  - M: Set of machines {1, ..., m}
- **Parameters**:
  - p_{j,m}: Processing time of job j on machine m
- **Variables**:
  - x_{j,s}: Binary variable, 1 if job j is assigned to position s
  - t_{s,m}: Start time of job in position s on machine m

$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Minimize} && t_{n,m} + \sum_{j \in J} p_{j,m} x_{j,n} \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{j \in J} x_{j,s} = 1 && \forall s \in S \\
& && \sum_{s \in S} x_{j,s} = 1 && \forall j \in J \\
& && t_{s,m+1} \geq t_{s,m} + \sum_{j \in J} p_{j,m} x_{j,s} && \forall s \in S, m < M \\
& && t_{s+1,m} \geq t_{s,m} + \sum_{j \in J} p_{j,m} x_{j,s} && \forall s < n, m \in M \\
& && x_{j,s} \in \{0,1\} && \forall j \in J, s \in S \\
& && t_{s,m} \geq 0 && \forall s \in S, m \in M
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example:
A manufacturing plant processes three types of products through a series of operations:
* Products to be processed:
  - Product A: Assembly (2h), Painting (1h), Quality Check (0.5h)
  - Product B: Assembly (1.5h), Painting (2h), Quality Check (1h)
  - Product C: Assembly (1h), Painting (1.5h), Quality Check (0.5h)
* Processing Requirements:
  - Each product must go through all operations in order
  - Only one product can be processed on a machine at a time
  - Operations sequence: Assembly → Painting → Quality Check
* Machine Configuration:
  - One Assembly Station
  - One Painting Booth
  - One Quality Check Station

The objective is to determine the optimal sequence of products through the production line to minimize the total completion time (makespan). For example, sequence C-A-B might result in completing all products by hour 8, while sequence B-C-A might require 9 hours. The challenge is finding the sequence that results in the minimum possible completion time while respecting all processing constraints and maintaining the required operation order.
